text:
KATE GROSCH: I am really
excited about this event

tonight because I
think it showcases

one of the most
exciting partnerships we
have at Harvard right now.

ROB HOWE: A master's
program that

combine design and engineering
and management aimed

towards creating extremely
effective entrepreneurs

in which students
earn both an MBA

and a Master of Science in
engineering in two years.

NITIN NOHRIA: Almost,
as an engineer,

I would have said that
that's an impossible thing,

that's an asymptote
that we cannot reach.

TOM EISENMANN: These
are new programs.
You're brave.
We love you.
We appreciate that.

You've been fantastic
partners in co-design,

this program is very
much about design.

And we couldn't wish
for anything better.

KATE GROSCH: I see that
we like to use technology
to help people.

NITIN NOHRIA: Almost all the
great businesses in the world,

they involve a great
technology and a business model

coming together to bring
amazing engineering
things to the world.

KATE GROSCH: I think that it
matters where we come from.

And I think it
matters what we do

because that's how we
bring difference and change
the world.
[MUSIC PLAYING]
